alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Newton; Rankin; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:08AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Rankin, Newton, Scott and western Lauderdale Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 408 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Steele to near Morton. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Prospect and Conehatta around 415 AM CDT. Stratton and Homewood around 425 AM CDT. Decatur around 430 AM CDT. Little Rock around 435 AM CDT. Lawrence and Duffee around 445 AM CDT. Martin and Roberts around 450 AM CDT. Newton around 455 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Chunky, Lake, Sebastopol and Hickory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for central and east central Mississippi.
